metadata.title: CVE-2020-24504 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Uncontrolled resource consumption in some Intel(R) Ethernet E810 Adapterdrivers for Linux before version 1.0.4 may allow an authenticated user topotentially enable denial of service via local access.

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0, was not-affected').
linux-gke-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.3').
linux-oracle-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.4').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was not-affected').
linux-oem-osp1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
